nl.vpro.util

Class ConfigUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.vpro.util.ConfigUtils

  • public class ConfigUtils
extends Object
    At VPRO we use an convention for configuring web-application using property-files. This boils down to a fall back mechanism:
    1. Look in {user.home}/conf/<application name>.properties
    2. Look in <classpath>/<applicationname>.properties
    This class provides utilities to arrange that. Also it is aware of Env (explicitely or via an 'env' property) so that there is a consistent system for varying properties across different OTAP deployments. I.e. it provides the means to calculate the actual values of the properties dependent on the available properties and environment. There are also methods combining this with ReflectionUtils to configure actual beans.
    Since:
    1.75
    Author:
    Michiel Meeuwissen

    • Method Detail

      • getConfigFilesInHome

        public static String[] getConfigFilesInHome(String... configFiles)
        Given a list of config file names, returns an array of resources representing it. For every entry this return a 'classpath' url and a file in user.home/conf
        Returns:
        An array twice the size of the input arguments

      • getPropertiesInHome

        public static Map<String,String> getProperties(String... configFiles)
        Given a list of urls/files resolve it to map of key/value settings Values also are 'subsituted' using substitute(java.util.Map<K, java.lang.String>, java.util.Map<java.lang.String, java.lang.String>)

      • getProperties

        public static Map<String,String> getProperties(Map<String,String> initial,
                                               String... configFiles)
        Given a list of urls/files resolve it to map of key/value settings, and add it to the given map.

      • getProperties

        public static <K> Map<K,String> getProperties(Map<K,String> initial,
                                              Function<String,K> keyGenerator,
                                              String... configFiles)
        Given a list of urls/files resolve it to map of key/value settings, and add it to the given map. The keys of this map are not Strings but object generated by the given keyGenerator. This allows for coalescing of equivalent keys.
